episode_summary: This episode of "No Such Thing As A Fish" covers a range of fascinating topics, including the noise levels of British warships, early European encounters with cannabis, the unique fishing methods of glowworms, and the linguistic diversity found in Queens, New York.

facts.fact: British warships are so noisy that enemy submarines can hear them from 100 miles away.
The first account of Europeans smoking cannabis reported that one hid in a jar for four hours, and another got into a fight with a pillar.
Glowworms go fishing with their own urine.
According to the Endangered Language Alliance, more languages are spoken in Queens, New York than anywhere else in the world.
